subject: Nutrition
title: Scurvy and Sea Exploration
description: A micro-lesson that makes Scurvy and Sea Exploration usable.

hook.text: Vasco da Gama lost 100 of his 170 crew to scurvy on a single voyage. The cure was on board.

buildup.text: Scurvy killed an estimated two million sailors between 1500 and 1800‚Äîmore than all naval battles combined.

discovery.text: James Lind's 1747 experiment was one of the first clinical trials in history, proving citrus cured scurvy.

twist.text: Captain Cook kept his crew scurvy-free with sauerkraut‚Äîbut credited the wrong mechanism for its success.

climax.text: The solution was known for decades before navies acted. Bureaucracy killed more sailors than disease.

punchline.text: Limes were cheap. Stubbornness was expensive.
